body:
It is really hard to detect the real `ppid` under Windows, however, there're some alternatives.
Possible solutions include:
1. Use a `HANDLE` to track if the parent is down. [example](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47659570/python-windows-exiting-child-process-when-unrelated-parent-dies-crashes).
2. Use job objects to let the OS to close for you. [example](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3342941/kill-child-process-when-parent-process-is-killed)
